data.title: Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanitie
meta_keywords: Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanitie
data.meta_description: Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanitie
data.text:
Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanities or Moscow State University for Humanities was founded in 1951 as Moscow Pedagogical Institute for Correspondence Studies. Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanities bears an honorary name of Michail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov - a Russian writer who won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1965. In 2002 Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanities was ranked by Russian Ministry of Education among 10 best pedagogical universities in Russia. It also ranked Sholokhov Moscow State University for Humanities among 14 best pedagogical and linguistic universities in Russia in 2005 (out of 78 rated).

Faculties and departments:

Speech pathology - Special speech pathology education

Design - Design

Journalism - Journalism

Fine and visual arts - Ornamental-applied arts and national trade

Foreign languages and international communications - Tourism and linguistic

History - Pedagogical education

Culture and musical arts - Pedagogical education, Musical instrumental arts, Vocal arts, Science of music and musically applied arts.

Pedagogic - Psycologic-Pedagogical education, pedagogical education

Psycology - Organization of work with young people, pedagogical education

Exact sciences and innovation technologies - Management in technical systems, pedagogical education

Language and literature department - Pedagogical education

Ecology and exact sciences - Ecology and nature management, pedagogical education

Law department - political science, jurisprudence

Chairs:

Foreign languages

Informatics and mathematics

History and culturology

Economy

Psychological and pedagogical education

Physical education

Philosophical and social and political disciplines

Natural science
